Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2010 10:08AM beth3172 wrote: Michelle- I got a huge, long, complicated explanation. I have to admit, I didn't get all of what the radiologist onc said, but I did get the jist. She determined that I would get too much of my body "cooked" and rads would hurt me more than help me.
Posts.Title: questions about radiation icey Chicago1018

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2010 09:28AM beth3172 wrote: I went in today for my rads "dry run." Instead of a simulated radiation tx, they informed me that I will not be getting radiation treatment! I was totally stunned. The radiologist said that because of my anatomy, there is no safe way to treat me with radiation. According to her, this could decrease my survival rate 3-4%. It sure seems like it would be a higher number. I'm a bit nervous, of course, but am also relieved that I don't have to have the treatment. This happen to anyone else?
Posts.Title: questions about radiation icey Chicago1018
